I successfully applied Polychrome edition to the 8 of Clubs (which had +4 Mult enhancement). This gives it X1.5 Mult, which will multiply my final multiplier by 1.5 when it's played.

I already have pairs of 5s and 3s, so adding either the Queen or 10 would create another pair. The Gold Card's money benefit requires holding it in hand rather than playing it, which conflicts with my current strategy of maximizing chip scoring through played cards.

Since I'm building around pairs and three of a kinds, I need another high-value card that contributes immediately when played. The Queen and 10 both offer +10 chips, though the Queen ranks higher in poker hierarchy. Given my focus on pair-based scoring, either would strengthen my hand more effectively than the Gold Card's delayed financial benefit.

The Queen of Diamonds pairs with my Queen of Hearts, giving me a solid two-pair foundation that aligns with my current strategy. I'll take position 3.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

What's left in the shop:

**Should I take Pluto?**

- It levels up High Card (+1 Mult and +10 chips)
- I have NEVER played High Card (0 times played)
- I focus on Three of a Kind, Two Pair, and Pair
- High Card is my fallback hand type that I don't actively use

Even though I don't actively play High Card, it's a FREE upgrade. However, since I need to have targets to use The Magician consumable on (it enhances 2 cards to Lucky Cards), and since I have a consumable slot available (1/2), I could potentially buy it if it appears.


---

My core strategy revolves around Three of a Kind with Zany Joker, Two Pair, and Pair plays, with Splash ensuring all cards contribute. Pluto would upgrade High Card, which I rarely trigger since it's just my fallback option. Taking a free upgrade seems logical, but I'm approaching the Big Blind and Boss Blind for this ante, so I should focus on what directly strengthens my primary hands rather than investing in a hand type I don't actively use. The free Pluto is worth taking since it has no cost and provides a potential backup. I haven't used The Magician yet, and while it could boost high-value cards with lucky effects—either +20 Mult or a $20 win—I should wait until I see my next hand before deciding where to apply it. For now, I'll grab Pluto and move forward to round select.
